{
    "number": 66361,
    "data": "2,18,17816,116624",
    "name": "The floor(n^(.9999))-perfect numbers, where f-perfect numbers for an arithmetical function f is defined in A066218.",
    "comment": [
        "Despite the closeness of f(n) = floor(n^(.9999)) to floor(n) (which generates the usual perfect numbers), the perfect numbers generated by these functions are quite different."
    ],
    "link": [
        "J. Pe, <a href=\"http://www.numeratus.net/fperfect/fperfect.html\">On a Generalization of Perfect Numbers</a>, J. Rec. Math., 31(3) (2002-2003), 168-172."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "f[x_] := Floor[x^(.9999)]; Select[ Range[2, 10^6], 2 * f[ # ] == Apply[ Plus, Map[ f, Divisors[ # ] ] ] & ]"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A066218."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Joseph L. Pe_, Dec 20 2001",
    "references": 0,
    "revision": 7,
    "time": "2018-12-18T09:09:38-05:00",
    "created": "2003-05-16T03:00:00-04:00"
}
